newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Boskalis secures Dfl 950 mln new orders in H1.
newsitem.headline: Boskalis secures Dfl 950 mln new orders in H1.

text.p: Dutch dredger Boskalis said on Friday it had won over 950 million guilders in new orders in the first half of 1996, taking its order book to 1.34 billion guilders at end-June from 881 million in January.
Boskalis reported first-half net profit fell to 27.5 million guilders from 41.4 million guilders a year earlier. Earnings per share amounted to 1.07 guilders, down from 1.63 guilders.
Based on the end-June order book, fleet capacity utilisation, turnover and result were seen improving in the second half compared to the first, the dredger said.
It said the market had improved strongly in the first half, particularly for trailing suction hopper dredgers.
"Contracts for a number of substantial projects in the Far East have ensured a solid fleet occupancy level as from the second half of 1996," Boskalis said.
In March, Boskalis clinched a 200 million guilder order for some four years' dredging work at Singapore's Changi airport.
In addition an upturn in the Dutch market coupled with "satisfactory" markets in Central and South America meant prices had shown some improvement, it said.
But the situation was still unsatisfactory in several other markets such as Germany and Nigeria and the offshore market for precision rock placement, the company added.
